intro: Horkelia elata, commonly known as the tall horkelia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and branching. Horkelia elata is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native range.
